1.title: Metasploit Basics - Starting a New Project
1.plot: We will cover the basics of Metasploit running on Kali Linux. Sometimes you may have connection issues when first starting up. If this has happened to you, then this episode may be for you. We also walk through creating a workspace for individual projects and nmap within the msfconsole. Once you know the basics, the rest falls into place.

2.title: Kali Linux using Tor, Filezilla, nmap and OWAS-ZAP through ProxyChains and more
2.plot: This episode uses Kali Linux as the operating system to install the tor service. Once installed, we use ProxyChains to allow most of our tools to use the Tor Onion network proxies. If ANY of the software gets updates, the screens may look different. Remember, this is the Tor network. This means that you can access normal Internet addresses and .onion addresses like GRAMS black market search engine and other darknet / darkweb sites. Don't break the law.

7.title: Mobile iPhone Backup iTunes Forensics
7.plot: In this episode, two tools are discussed for doing forensics on an iTune's iPhone Backup. We use iPhone analyzer and iPBA2 to uncover basic information. There is a lot of good information you can find in the backup file, and this episode just scratches the surface.

8.title: Hacking Android Devices - Baksmaling APK Files
8.plot: In this episode, we will be discussing how to hack Android apps using baksmali (atpktool and some custom tools). It is a lot easier to hack the Android APKs or apps than you think.

1.title: Common Digital Forensic Laws & Common Screw-ups
1.plot: This episode covers common cyber forensics mistakes that occur in both the law enforcement community and the commercial space. Remember, forensics IS A SCIENCE. Digital forensics is the act of proving of disproving a theory in a scientifically reproducible manor. This episode covers that.

2.title: Wifi Attack (& Forensic) Tools - WEP, WPA, WPS, SSL, & MitM Are Possible Now.
2.plot: Good morning. Welcome to another episode of Cyber Secrets. In this episode, we will cover three tools used for wireless assessments. This includes the Reaver Pro for WPA / WPS keys, Wifi Pineapple Mark v for man in the middle and other wireless attacks, and the Raspberry Pi with Kali Linux installed.

3.title: Email Investigating and Spoofing - What Can You Trust?
3.plot: Good morning. Welcome to another episode of Cyber Secrets. In this episode, we will cover the basics of email, evidence in email, and how easy it is to spoof email. Spoofing and faking header information? Is this possible? Yep... Quite easy actually.

imdb.plot outline: Cyber Secrets is an educational web series that covers subjects ranging from digital forensics to hacking computers to security and intelligence gathering. Since the series covers so many subjects, everyone can learn something from watching. The first episodes cover Anonymity and the Tor Onion routing network. After that, the coverage moves toward forensics and then to hacking / system exploitation.
imdb.title: Cyber Secrets
plot: _Cyber Secrets_ (qv) is an educational web series that covers subjects ranging from digital forensics to hacking computers to security and intelligence gathering. Since the series covers so many subjects, everyone can learn something from watching. The first episodes cover Anonymity and the Tor Onion routing network. After that, the coverage moves toward forensics and then to hacking / system exploitation.::Jeremy Martin
